Find out their positions on protecting your civil liberties.
Meet the candidates

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

As we near the November 6 election, ACLU members and supporters are considering how their choice for a number of public offices that impact how civil liberties are respected in our state. One office that merits special attention is Illinois attorney general. As the chief legal officer for the State of Illinois, our attorney general can significantly impact civil liberties — through decisions about which cases to pursue, when to join multi-state litigation and how to weigh in on the legislative process when civil liberties matters are being debated.

Get to know the positions of the candidates for Illinois attorney general.

This year, we sent a series of questions to all three candidates for the office of attorney general, and received responses from two out of the three. We asked for their views about issues you care about — including access to reproductive health care, LGBTQ rights, immigration and criminal justice reform. We hope you will take a few minutes to read the answers we got back to those questions.

There are 10 days left before the election. We encourage you to make a plan to vote, urge others to make a plan for vote, and then vote like your rights depend on it.

Thanks for sticking with us,

Khadine Bennett
Director of Advocacy and Intergovernmental Affairs, ACLU of Illinois
